entry.title: Buckley's Chance
entry.summary:
Author: RaspberryDreams1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,868Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 314

Summary: Evan knows that wish babies are extremely rare, the Fae only grant a handful of wishes per year and almost never to single parents. But Evan so desperately wants a family to love that he’s been subconsciously wishing since he was a teenager. Eddie hadn’t thought of wishing for a baby, he had barely heard of wish babies or soulmates, his parents didn’t believe in such things. Eddie desperately wanted a place for him and his son to belong, a family that would accept him without demanding that he change who he was to fit their impossibly unrealistic expectations.

entry.title: Dovecote
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 101,789Chapters: 18/23Kudos: 156

Summary: Buck held the little plastic bird close in front of his eyes, twisting it back and forth.“You can say it, Buck,” Eddie encouraged, quietly. “To put it out there in… the universe. And you’ll see her tomorrow, anyway.”“I think…” Buck took a huge breath, breathing deep into his chest, past the hurt, past the hard rock of anxiety that sat at its center, past the tears welling in his eyes; he aimed all of it back out, straight into the heart of the deep, deep universe.“I think I met my daughter tonight.” or;A work of fate or God or man or the universe crosses the paths of Buck and a small, green-eyed girl with a bird in her palm and the future in her snaggle-toothed grin. Two and a half years after the events of Lighthouse, the Diazes become the Diazes.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 88,868Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 26

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 75,567Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 11

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 77,187Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Boy Next Door
entry.summary:
Author: buddiesongfic

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,931Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck smiles, almost too warm. “God, you're handsome, you know that?” Eddie chuckled, even though a flicker of discomfort ran through him. “Handsome, loyal, great, sexy…” Buck’s voice trailed, soft but deliberate. Eddie stood up, reaching for his jacket, letting out a huffing laugh at the last word. But when he turned around… Buck was already close. “So sexy…” Buck hushed, his face just inches from Eddie’s. The words were soft, intimate, but the gaze—locked, lingering—made Eddie freeze. OR; the literal (Maybe not) story of the movie The Boy Next Door

entry.title: Thirst Bound
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,982Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 163

Summary: Buck came back from Peru with a secret.A dangerous one. He thought he could hide it forever — the fangs, the hunger, the way his entire body aches when he catches the faintest whiff of blood. But when Eddie walks in on him feeding, everything Buck’s been trying to bury unravels in seconds. Eddie should be terrified.Instead, he offers himself up. Eddie should be scared of Buck’s fangs. Instead, he’s begging for them.

entry.title: New Friends Meet Old
entry.summary:
Author: Martian2045

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,276Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 269

Summary: It's just a normal 12-hour overnight shift when Eddie notices that Buck is acting weird. Like weirder than usual, which is saying something for him.What happens when ghosts from a past that Eddie didn't even know existed until today come crawling out, and he meets a side of Buck he never knew? What does Buck do when his families collide? His past with his present? And to top it all off, he feels more alive than he has in years.But he hasn’t seen Hondo in a long time—not since everything fell apart—and now that he’s back on SWAT’s radar, it’s only a matter of time before more familiar faces start showing up, asking questions Buck’s not sure he’s ready to answer.

entry.title: Forgive Me Father For I Am… Homophobic?
entry.summary:
Author: Aizawas_Trash_Can

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,614Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 42

Summary: "He paused for a few beats, taking the chance to look through the little window to see who sat on the other side. Eddie felt a little more at ease when he saw the familiar face of Father Brian. That meant that Eddie didn’t have to start from the very beginning and talk to a complete stranger who didn’t know anything about him or his story. It might not make Father Brian more comfortable to know some of Eddie’s trauma, but in the moment it gives Eddie a little comfort.“Bless me father for I have sinned.”“What can I do for you?”“Well, I have to confess to feeling hatred towards a certain group of people… most of all my best friend. I think that… Father, I think that I’m homophobic…”“WHAT???”"Or,The one where Buck has a new boyfriend and Eddie can't figure out why seeing them together makes him so upset. He ends up going to confession and makes Father Brian question his career choice.

entry.title: Keep Me (In the Pocket of your Jeans)
entry.summary:
Author: Pxrpls

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 206,642Chapters: 27/?Kudos: 668

Summary: That’s his problem. Buck always manages to make the calls personal, even if they are so far behind his realm of reality. He always makes them about himself, he had been told this way too many times already. And he’s trying to change, he really is. But then there are moments like these in which a little girl needs saving and Buck blurs the line between what’s his job and his own need to be there for everyone he meets. His need to fix everything. So he stays there, just for that first surgery he keeps reminding himself, just to make sure she makes it out of the ER. Just to make sure Hen is right and she is in good hands. And a few hours later, when she makes it out and the doctor’s look around the waiting room for Cassie’s parents without all the context Buck already has, he stands up. On instinct. Barely even a lie. He couldn’t count it as one when he hadn’t spoken at all. He just stands up. He stands up and he follows the doctor to the ICU. In which Buck worries about the little girl he just saved from a fire, and he gives her a home in his arms.
